panels.description: Number of Hosts in the Cluster

targets.rawSql:
-- DR3 - This query returns the
-- number of hosts and the number of vms
-- in the latest cluster configuration

SELECT
    COUNT (
        DISTINCT v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id
    ) AS host_count
FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
            v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id
        )
WHERE
    --Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST( '$cluster_id' as UUID )

panels.title: Number of Host

panels.description: Number of Hosts in the Cluster

targets.rawSql:
-- DR3 - This query returns the
-- number of hosts and the number of vms
-- in the latest cluster configuration

SELECT
    COUNT (
        DISTINCT v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id
    ) AS vm_count
FROM v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
            v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id
        )
WHERE
    --Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST( '$cluster_id' as UUID )

panels.title: Number of Virtual Machines

panels.description: -- DR6 - This query returns the average uptime percent for the hosts in the specific cluster

targets.rawSql:
-- DR6 - This query returns the average
-- uptime percent for the hosts in the specific cluster

SELECT
    (
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN
                    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
                        THEN
                            COALESCE (
                                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                                0
                            )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) /
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
        )
    ) * 100
    AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' as UUID )

panels.title: Cluster Host Uptime Status (DR6)

panels.description: -- DR12 - This query returns the average resources that are not used ( cpu and memory ) for the specific cluster

targets.rawSql:
-- DR12 - This query returns the average
-- resources that are not used ( cpu and memory )
-- for the specific cluster the 

SELECT
    100 -
    (
        cpu_usage_percent_avg + memory_usage_percent_avg
    ) /
    2
    AS average_resources_not_used
FROM (
    SELECT
        AVG (
            cpu_usage_percent
        ) AS cpu_usage_percent_avg,
        AVG (
            memory_usage_percent
        ) AS memory_usage_percent_avg
    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
        INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
            ON (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we get only active hosts
        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
        CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
) AS average_resources

panels.title: Cluster Host Resources Status (DR12)

panels.description: -- DR13 - This query returns the uptime percent of high availability vms.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR13 - This query returns the
-- uptime percent of high availability vms.

SELECT
    (
        SUM
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
                        THEN
                            COALESCE (
                                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                                0
                            )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) /
            SUM (
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
            )
    ) * 100
    AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id =
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only high availability vms
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.high_availability = TRUE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id = CAST( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

panels.title: Cluster High Availability Virtual Machine Uptime Status (DR13)

panels.description: -- DR28 - This query returns the average cpu and memory peaks per host for the specific cluster

targets.rawSql:
-- DR28 - This query returns the
-- average cpu and memory peaks per host
-- for the specific cluster

SELECT
    host_id,
    host_name,
    AVG ( cpu_peak ) AS avg_cpu_peak,
    AVG ( mem_peak ) AS avg_mem_peak
FROM (
    -- Calculation of samples cpu and memory usage peaks
    SELECT
        v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
        v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
        MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_peak,
        MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) AS mem_peak
    FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
        INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
            ON (
                v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we filter by active hosts only
        v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
        AND v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
        CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
    GROUP BY
        v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
        v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
        DATE_TRUNC (
            'hour',
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.history_datetime
        )
) AS TBL_samples_PEAKS
GROUP BY
    host_id,
    host_name

panels.title: Cluster Summary of Hosts Resources Usage (DR28)

panels.description: -- DR23 - This query returns the cpu and memory usage for the top 5 busiest hosts

targets.rawSql:
-- DR23 - This query returns the
-- cpu and memory usage for the
-- top 5 busiest hosts

SELECT
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
    AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_avg,
    MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_max,
    AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_avg,
    MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_max
FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only active hosts
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
    CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )
GROUP BY
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name
ORDER BY
    AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) +
    MAX ( cpu_usage_percent ) +
    AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) +
    MAX ( memory_usage_percent ) DESC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Cluster Top Five Busiest Hosts (DR23)

panels.description: -- DR14 - This query returns the average number of CPU Cores for the hosts and vms in the specific cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR14 - This query returns the
-- average number of CPU Cores and Physical Memory
-- for the hosts and vms in the specific cluster.

-- Hosts CPU Cores Total and Hosts Physical Memory Total
SELECT
    now() AS time,
    'Total Hosts CPU Cores' AS entity,
    SUM (
        COALESCE (
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.number_of_cores,
            0
        ) *
        minutes_in_status
    ) /
    SUM (
        minutes_in_status
    )
    AS cpu_cores
FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
        ON (
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id =
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_configuration_version
        )
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts AS a
        ON (
            a.host_id =
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only active hosts
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

UNION ALL

-- vms CPU Cores Total and vms Physical Memory Total
SELECT
    now() AS time,
    'Total VMs Physical CPU' AS entity,
    SUM (
        nested_query.cpu_cores
    ) AS cpu_cores_total
FROM (
    SELECT
        a.vm_id,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cpu_per_socket,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.number_of_sockets,
                0
            ) *
            minutes_in_status
        ) /
        SUM ( minutes_in_status ) AS cpu_cores,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.memory_size_mb,
                0
            ) *
            minutes_in_status
        ) /
        SUM (
            minutes_in_status
        ) AS mem_avg
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_configuration_version
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms AS a
            ON (
                a.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we get only active vms
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
        AND a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS uuid )
       GROUP BY a.vm_id
) AS nested_query

panels.title: Cluster Virtual Machine CPU Over Commit Status (DR14)

panels.description: -- DR14 - This query returns the average Physical Memory for the hosts and vms in the specific cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR14 - This query returns the
-- average number of CPU Cores and Physical Memory
-- for the hosts and vms in the specific cluster.

-- Hosts CPU Cores Total and Hosts Physical Memory Total
SELECT
    now() AS time,
    'Total Hosts Physical Memory' AS entity,
    SUM (
        COALESCE (
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.memory_size_mb,
            0
        ) *
        minutes_in_status
    ) /
    SUM (
        minutes_in_status
    ) AS mem_avg
FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_hosts
        ON (
            v4_3_configuration_history_hosts.history_id =
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_configuration_version
        )
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts AS a
        ON (
            a.host_id =
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we get only active hosts
    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    AND a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS UUID )

UNION ALL

-- vms CPU Cores Total and vms Physical Memory Total
SELECT
    now() AS time,
    'Total VMs Physical Memory' AS entity,
    SUM (
        nested_query.mem_avg
    ) AS mem_avg_total
FROM (
    SELECT
        a.vm_id,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.cpu_per_socket,
                0
            ) *
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.number_of_sockets,
                0
            ) *
            minutes_in_status
        ) /
        SUM ( minutes_in_status ) AS cpu_cores,
        SUM (
            COALESCE (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.memory_size_mb,
                0
            ) *
            minutes_in_status
        ) /
        SUM (
            minutes_in_status
        ) AS mem_avg
    FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
        INNER JOIN v4_3_configuration_history_vms
            ON (
                v4_3_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_configuration_version
            )
        INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms AS a
            ON (
                a.vm_id =
                v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
            )
    WHERE
        -- Here we get only active vms
        v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
        -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
        AND a.cluster_id = CAST ( '$cluster_id' AS uuid )
       GROUP BY a.vm_id
) AS nested_query

panels.title: Cluster Virtual Machine Memory Over Commit Status (DR14)

panels.description: -- DR20 - This query returns for 5 high availability vms, that have the least uptime percent, the total uptime and planned downtime percent.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR20 - This query returns for 5 high availability vms,
-- that have the least uptime percent,
-- the total uptime and planned downtime percent.

SELECT
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id, v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_name,
    (
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) /
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
        )
    ) * 100
    AS uptime_percent,
    (
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_status IN ( 0, 2 )
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) /
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
        )
    ) * 100
    AS planned_downtime_percent
FROM v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_vms
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id =
            v4_3_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples.vm_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.cluster_id =
    CAST ( '$cluster_id' as UUID )
    -- Here we get only high availability vms
    AND v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.high_availability = TRUE
GROUP BY
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_vms.vm_name
ORDER BY uptime_percent ASC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Top Five High Availability Virtual Servers Downtime (DR20)

panels.description: -- DR18 - This query returns for 5 hosts, that have downtime percent, the total uptime, planned and unplanned downtime percent.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR18 - This query returns for 5 hosts,
-- that have downtime percent, the total uptime,
-- planned and unplanned downtime percent.

SELECT
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name,
    (
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN
                    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 1
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) /
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
        )
    ) * 100
    AS uptime_percent,
    (
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN
                    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 2
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) /
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
        )
    ) * 100
    AS planned_downtime_percent,
    (
        SUM (
            CASE
                WHEN
                    v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_status = 3
                    THEN
                        COALESCE (
                            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status,
                            0
                        )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) /
        SUM (
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.minutes_in_status
        )
    ) * 100
    AS unplanned_downtime_percent
FROM v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    INNER JOIN v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts
        ON (
            v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
            v4_3_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples.host_id
        )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the cluster chosen by the user
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id =
    CAST ( '$cluster_id' as UUID )
GROUP BY
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id,
    v4_3_latest_configuration_hosts.host_name
ORDER BY
    uptime_percent ASC,
    unplanned_downtime_percent DESC,
    planned_downtime_percent DESC
LIMIT 5

panels.title: Top Five Hosts Downtime (DR18)

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text, datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters
list.label: Data Canter
list.name: datacenter_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_name AS __text, datacenter_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_datacenters

list.definition: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN  ('$datacenter_id')
list.label: Cluster
list.name: cluster_id
list.query: SELECT DISTINCT cluster_name AS __text, cluster_id AS __value FROM v4_3_configuration_history_clusters WHERE datacenter_id IN  ('$datacenter_id')
